content: perhaps you could include th3 message, because Thunderbird does not scan outgoing mail for anything like phishing, my guess is it has something to do with your security suite, your mail provider or the recipients mail server. As I do not have access to the actual message (screen shot) I can really not do more than guess.
creator: MattAuSupport

Is there even such a thing?

Not at this time.

See https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/04/thundermail-and-thunderbird-pro-services/ and an update https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/06/video-thunderbird-pro-and-thundermail/ and the wait list site https://thundermail.com/

content: What server is encountering the error? That message does not say, which leads me to think the "server" might be your antivirus product. Do you have something scanning outgoing mail?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks for response Matt, could you please advise how to check server info locally? My laptop only has Windows security center, no other 3rd party anti-virus app installed.
creator: chandler.chen

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next
